introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Baccarat, known as Punto Banco, is one of the oldest and most popular card games in casinos worldwide, especially among skilled gamblers and in Asia. Baccarat is particularly dominant in Macau.
introduction.content-2: Despite its serious and elegant appearance, the game is quite simple. You only need to bet on which side will win or if there will be a tie.

goal.title: Game Objective
goal.content: The goal of Baccarat is to predict which side will have the highest card value or come closest to a total of 9 (Player, Banker, or Tie).

rules.title: General Rules
steps: The game will be guided by the Dealer.
The game uses 8 decks of cards in one Shoe.
At the beginning of a new Shoe, the Dealer will draw one card to determine how many cards will be Burned. A maximum of 11 cards can be discarded.
After the betting time ends, the Dealer will deal two cards to the Player and the Banker.
The hand with the highest card value wins.
If the result is a tie, bets on Player and Banker are returned. A tie bet only wins if the values of Player and Banker are the same.
If the result is a non-natural tie, meaning a tie with more than four cards dealt, then Player Bonus and Banker Bonus bets lose.
If the result is a natural tie, meaning a tie with four cards dealt, then Player Bonus and Banker Bonus bets are returned.

card-value.title: Card Values
card-value.description: Baccarat uses a standard set of cards consisting of 52 cards, without jokers. Here are the card values used in the game:

point-count.title: Point Calculation
point-count.description: All cards in Baccarat are valued only by their last digit. The highest value is 9. If the sum of the values of 2 cards is a two-digit number, the total value is determined by the digit in the second position.

natural-card.title: NATURAL CARD
natural-card.description: If the initial 2 cards of the Player or Banker have a value of 8 or 9, it is considered a Natural Card and no additional cards will be drawn for either side.

non-natural-card.title: NON-NATURAL CARD
non-natural-card.description: If the initial 2 cards of the Player or Banker have a value of 0-7, it is considered a Non-Natural Card and additional cards will be drawn. The rules for the third card will be explained further in the next section.

player.title: PLAYER
player.description: The rules for the third card for the Player depend on the value of the two Player cards

banker.title: BANKER
banker.description: The rules for the third card for the Banker depend on the value of the two Banker cards and the value of the Player's third card.

dragon-bonus.title: Dragon Bonus
dragon-bonus.description: Dragon Bonus is introduced as an additional bet in Baccarat to enhance the excitement of the game with larger rewards than regular bets. Here are the simple rules:

how-to-bet.heading: Betting and How to Bet
steps: Dragon Bonus is divided into Player Bonus and Banker Bonus
As a main requirement, you must place a primary bet (Player, Banker, or Tie)
Only after that can you place a bet on Player Bonus or Banker Bonus

winning-rules.heading: Determining the Winner
steps: Similar to the main betting rules, to win, the value of the bonus bet must be greater than the opponent's.
Dragon Bonus has a unique payout system. The size of the victory margin determines the payout amount.
The larger the winning margin, the greater the payout.

additional-rules.heading: Additional Rules
steps: Game results of Win with Natural and Tie have special rules that affect payouts.
Information on special rules will be explained in the next section.

player.title: Player
player.description: Paid if the value of Player is greater than the value of Banker

banker.title: Banker
banker.description: Paid if the value of Banker is greater than the value of Player

tie.title: Tie
tie.description: Paid if the cards of Player and Banker have the same value

player-pair.title: Player Pair
player-pair.description: Paid if the first two cards of Player are a pair

banker-pair.title: Banker Pair
banker-pair.description: Paid if the first two cards of Banker are a pair

perfect-pair.title: Perfect Pair
perfect-pair.description: Paid if only one side, either Player or Banker, gets identical cards

perfect-pair-2.title: Perfect Pair
perfect-pair-2.description: Paid if both sides, Player and Banker, get identical cards

mixed-pair.title: Mixed Pair
mixed-pair.description: Paid if the first two cards from either side, Player or Banker, are a pair

player-bonus.title: Player Bonus
player-bonus.description: Paid if the Player wins with Natural 8 or 9, or at least wins with a 4-point margin

banker-bonus.title: Banker Bonus
banker-bonus.description: Paid if the Banker wins with Natural 8 or 9, or at least wins with a 4-point margin

tie-on-0-9.title: Tie On 0-9
tie-on-0-9.description: Paid if the game result is a Tie with value 0-9

small.title: Small
small.description: Paid if the number of cards dealt is 4

big.title: Big
big.description: Paid if the number of cards dealt is 5 or 6
